intro: Atropis distans var. tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered atropis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface, and its small, white flowers are arranged in clustered umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
